documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
. When asked for a
definition, it is appropriate to reply: “What sort of definition do you want,
and why do you want it?” Of course, if you are using a word in a way that
departs from customary usage, or using it in some special way of your own,
or using a word that is too vague for the given context, or using a word in
an ambiguous way, then the request for a definition is perfectly in order. In
such  cases,  the  demand  for  a  definition  represents  an  important  move
within the argument r
